Services

Service IV:Graphics Development

Our team has experienced software engineers with expertise in 2D and 3D graphics research and engineering, with deep knowledge regarding most modern optimizations. We have strong experience in WebGL and WebGPU application development. We have strong experience of working with ThreeJS, BabylonJS, Unity, Bevy, Notan, and Fyrox technologies.

Technology stack: JavaScript, WebGL, Three.js, WebGPU, Babylon.js, Vue.js, Unity, Blender, 3D Animation, Shaders

    We're able to help you with:
  • - Supporting and enhancing the Web Viewer for 3D models (written in WebGL/WebGPU)
  • - Optimizing and improving the rendering pipeline
  • - Web applications to set up, execute, and visualize the results of various models
  • - Creating visualizations based on model-generated data sets
  • - Adding and researching new features for the 3D engine
  • - Implementation a WebGL and WebGPU renderer for game engine
  • - UX and UI design
  • - 3d modeling
  • - Physics, and internet network optimization
  • - Interactive website design & development (2D/3D)
  • - 3D product customizer

Portfolio

Finance Data Visualizer

Competencies: JavaScript, Vue, Three.js, 3D Animation

Participated in development of Fizzi.io - web service for visualization of the stock market. Our role was to develop a part of the app with helix. For this purpose we wrote custom ThreeJS geometry as a 3D mesh of triangles in the form of a 3D spiral.

Background scene for a website

Competencies: Java Script, WebGL, Three.js, Blender, 3D Animation

Quite a typical task with Three.js. Most complex part was to combine animation using waypoints and user mouse input. We used my own animation library for it. Models are imported from Blender as FBX files. Shining light sources are spheres with shader material (luminosity shader).

Wow-effect animation for the web page

Competencies: WebGL, Rust, Animation

The goal of this project was to create wow-effect animation on the web page. Using WebGl and Rust we animated the crypto-icons by adding their rotation around the axes we needed. In addition, the movement of those icons is interdependent with the movement of the mouse.
